intro: Urophyllum schmidtii, commonly known as the Schmidt's ururophyllum, is a rare flowering plant native to specific regions of South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads composed of ray and disk florets. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and exhibits a compact, shrub-like growth form. Its flowers are small and often yellow or brown, contributing to its ecological role in pollination. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a species of conservation concern.
